intro: Dorstenia ophiocoma var. minor, commonly known as the miniature giant hogweed, is a unique member of the Moraceae family. It is a climbing shrub characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and distinctive, spiral-shaped inflorescences. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in a unique, spiral pattern that resembles a helix. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded, moist environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for horticultural and ecological studies.
